meanings.definition: To label or market a product with false or misleading information.
meanings.sent1: The company was caught misbranding their supplements by claiming false benefits.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal to misbrand products by providing inaccurate information on the labels.
meanings.sent3: The misbranding of the new energy drink led to confusion among customers.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were like misbranding her personality, presenting a false image to others.
meanings.sent5: Misbranding can harm a company's reputation and trustworthiness.

meanings.definition: The act of improperly labeling or advertising a product.
meanings.sent1: Misbranding can result in legal consequences for companies that deceive consumers.
meanings.sent2: Consumers filed complaints about the misbranding of the health supplements.
meanings.sent3: The misbranding of the toy made it seem more exciting than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: The misbranding of the product was like dressing up a plain item in fancy packaging.
meanings.sent5: The misbranding of the medication caused confusion among patients.

meanings.definition: The practice of misrepresenting a product through its branding.
meanings.sent1: Misbranding can lead to a loss of customer trust in a brand.
meanings.sent2: The misbranding of the clothing line resulted in a drop in sales.
meanings.sent3: The misbranding of the car made it seem more luxurious than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: The misbranding of the software was like putting a fancy cover on a basic program.
meanings.sent5: The misbranding of the food product misled consumers about its ingredients.
